snippet: “The Duchess of Malfi,” a Jacobean tragedy that just ended its run at Old Vic in London, was written when memories of the first Queen Elizabeth were fresh. Now it provokes Ben Brantley’s reflections on the present queen.
abstract: “The Duchess of Malfi,” a Jacobean tragedy that just ended its run at Old Vic in London, was written when memories of the first Queen Elizabeth were fresh. Now it provokes Ben Brantley’s reflections on the present queen.

headline.main: London Theater Journal: Another Prisoner of Noble Title
